text:
Make sure their dns settings only point to your internal ad/dns and someone
didn’t add an outside dns entry to their network stack… 
I have seen vendors or inexperienced tecks add google dns or other such entries
while troubleshooting issues and leaving them there…

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] RDP NLA Issue
metadata.email_text_original:
You don't often get email from thedobc@gmail.com. Learn why this is important
[https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification] 
Make sure their dns settings only point to your internal ad/dns and someone
didn’t add an outside dns entry to their network stack… 
I have seen vendors or inexperienced tecks add google dns or other such entries
while troubleshooting issues and leaving them there… 
From: 'Brown, Jeff' via PatchManagement <patchmanagement@googlegroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, February 1, 2024 6:17 AM
To: patchmanagement@googlegroups.com
Subject: [patchmanagement] RDP NLA Issue 
All, 
Does anyone have ideas about to resolve this issue? 
We have several Server 2022 hosts on a Server 2022 domain.  Every few weeks our
international employees can no longer RDP to these machines.  They get a “The
remote computer that you are trying to connect to requires Network Level
Authentication (NLA), but your Windows domain controller cannot be contacted to
perform NLA…” error message. 
I can still RDP to these hosts without issue and removing/readding the machines
to the same domain clears the problem for a while. 
--
Link: https://groups.google.com/d/msgid/patchmanagement/007901da5530%2449092c20%24db1b8460%24%40gmail.com
